subject: Philosophy
title: Syllogisms
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Syllogisms.

hook.text: All humans are mortal. Socrates is human. Therefore Socrates is mortal. That's a syllogism â€” logic's greatest hit.

buildup.text: Aristotle invented the syllogism: two premises leading to an unavoidable conclusion.

discovery.text: If the premises are true and the form is valid, the conclusion must be true. No exceptions.

twist.text: The power of deduction: the conclusion adds no new information. It reveals what was already hidden in the premises.

climax.text: Syllogisms dominated Western logic for two thousand years. They're still the backbone of critical thinking.

punchline.text: The conclusion was in the premises all along.

quiz.question: What is a syllogism?
options: Two premises leading to a necessary conclusion
